chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Stefaniak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Cost to be paid in full within 60 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
 Court waives standard Fine and Court Cost.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L Stefaniak

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

03:24 PM; Case called for Plea and Sentencing hearing.  Defendant Christopher L Stefaniak in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court notes the plea questionnaire has been filed and inquires if parties are prepared to proceed today.
Atty. Mastantuono advises he is prepared to proceed today and recites the offer.
Atty. Pitzo confirms the offer.
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.
Court 2 is dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Pitzo.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Mastantuono.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 1
The Court Orders the Following:

FINE or COSTS: Waived by the Court.
	
DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid within 60 days .   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

01:34 PM Defendant Christopher L Stefaniak in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

08:24 AM Defendant Christopher L Stefaniak in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Attorney Mastantuono requests a status of prelim date.  Hearing scheduled for February 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
